activities: The organization's U.S. based employees may process employees' personal data received from the EU for any and all employment-related purposes, including but not limited to,merger integration; recruitment; employee communications; workforce management and planning; performance management; organizational movements; employee mobility; to manage compensation, payroll, rewards, incentive programs, benefits, perquisites and allowances; administering physical and information systems security; to address various legal obligations related to the employment relationship, including investigations and discovery obligations in civil discovery; to engage in succession planning and employee development; to administer training; to administer the Company’s compliance hotline or other reporting mechanisms; and for emergency contact purposes.
eucountries: Belgium, Finland, France, Germany, Hungary, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Spain, United Kingdom
personaldata: Any personal data in electronic or paper form regarding the organization's employees located in the E.U.
